column5: Went out last week to 8", lots of snow and slush. Not safe enough near the current to bring out the kids. Shoveled te snow off and had good cold days since:) ventured down this am after coffee, drilled my way out with my new shark and made it 30-40 ft out with 11". So out we go to play with some fishies and new toys:) my new auger is amazing, love it. Got it on the cheap too$175 used once. Now im anxious to try my brand new 4x elite:) weather is nice, bout -13 should br diwn there all day! Letshope the fish cooperate but will be fun regardless.
That sounds awesome and the making for a great time!
One walleye and a few misses so far. The elite took a while to set up but shes working great now!
This just in...
That's a beauty.!!!!!
Yum!! Dinner?
This just in....
nice fish, keep the up-dates coming
Your on a roll now
Better hurry,it's the shortest day of the year you know  .
nice fish!!
Gotta few more small ones. This elite unit is awesome!!!
Where is RR?
Rainy River tb Great stuff... shovel the kids a future rink and caught fish all at the same time!
Well it was a great day! Awesome. Be out again tomorrow for sure;)

Touched up! What an awesome day. Loving my elite 4x. . Caught about 12 in all. Some big eyes and pike. Action was good enough that we missed some pics just being too busy. Great first day on hardwater

Awesome Rick, hows the current there on the ice? i can see you are sitting in that part that is an eddy with slack water…but i seem to remember the current rips through the rapids there. That is where you are right?
YEAH BABY…..Rainy River SUSHI !
Good on ya!  You are in God's country!
And yeah we were drilling on some heavy current. 11" of real good ice though. Nobody dared to venture bear the rapids, we stayed 100 yards or so away
